question: Which two countries share the location of the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Tokaj wine region"?
explanation: Hungary and Slovakia are the two countries that share the location of the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Tokaj wine region". Tokaj wine region or Tokaj-Hegyalja wine region is a historical wine region located in northeastern Hungary and southeastern Slovakia. It is also one of the seven larger wine regions of Hungary. Tokaj has been declared a World Heritage Site in 2002 under the name Tokaj Wine Region Historic Cultural Landscape. However, its fame long predated this distinction because it is the origin of Tokaji aszu wine, the world's oldest botrytized wine. Due to the Treaty of Trianon, a smaller part of the historical wine region now belongs to Slovakia.
